question.title: Application shows blank white screen and site is whitelisted
question.body:
I'm trying to run a legacy Java applet application in Microsoft Edge using IE Mode, as modern browsers no longer support NPAPI plugins required by Java applets.

What I've done so far:

  • Enabled “Allow sites to be reloaded in Internet Explorer mode” in Edge settings.
  • Added the applet site URL to the IE Mode site list and Java Exception Site List in Java Control Panel.
  • Installed and verified that the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is installed with the Java plugin enabled:
  • Java Plug-In 1.6.0 enabled
  • Java(tm) Plug-In 2 SSV Helper enabled
  • Java(tm) Plug-In SSV Helper enabled
  • Enabled Java Console to show for debugging (though it does not open automatically).
  • Added the site to Compatibility View Settings in Internet Explorer.
  • Confirmed Java plugin is enabled in Internet Explorer via Manage Add-ons.
  • Cleared Edge browser cache and cookies.
  • Set browser zoom and Windows display scaling to 100%.
  • Verified network resources load successfully in Edge Developer Tools (IE Mode).
  • Observed that the applet popup appears with a scrollbar, but the applet content area remains blank white.

Additional notes:

The application popup indicates the applet is attempting to load. No visible errors in browser console. Java Console does not open automatically; unable to capture detailed Java runtime errors.

Java version is 1.6.0, but considering trying Java 8 JRE for compatibility. I suspect possible security restrictions or applet signing issues, but no explicit warnings shown.

Edge version : Version 137.0.3296.68

What else can be checked or configured to diagnose and resolve a Java applet that shows a blank white screen in IE Mode on Microsoft Edge?

Are there any known quirks or troubleshooting steps for Java applets running in IE Mode that might help reveal the root cause?
